item.description:
Penn Jillette, of the Las Vagas magic duo Penn & Teller, has written a book on his views on atheism.  God, No! Signs You May Already Be An Atheist and Other Magical Tales

(Penn is the one that does all the talking.  He likes to talk.  He also invented the Jill-Jet.)

 

What sort of Ten Commandments would an atheist consider valid? We'll explore the ten that Penn came up. What is a reasonable foundation for morality if not from religion?

 

Bring a commandment or two to the discussion!   Let's see which one's the group thinks worthy of the top ten?  ;-)   

 

After the formal discussion, we'll head over to Orleans for a bite to eat, some adult beverages and socializing. 

 

Note, Inquisitive Minds is made up of members from various religious and non-religious outlooks. We welcome a diverse viewpoint of ideas and views discussed in a respectful manner. Discussions are moderated.

 

Also note, Penn & Teller helped get the word out about dihydrogen monoxide, with

their petition to ban dihydrogen monoxide
item.name: An Atheist's Ten Commandents.
